abstract.p: Town Board in Yorktown, NY, is expected to approve arrangement by which Yorktown Theater will be allowed to stage shows at Cultural and Community Center rent free (S)

block.p: Yorktown Stage's shows will go on at the town's Cultural and Community Center, under an arrangement that the Town Board is expected to approve next month.

The theater company has been performing at the center since September 1998; it had been operating under a three-year agreement, which called for $500 a month in rent this September. Last month Barry Liebman, who brought the theater to Yorktown, asked the board to drop the rent payment. He said that although the theater had drawn more than 100,000 people to its productions, it has not made a profit.
Yorktown Stage's shows will go on at the town's Cultural and Community Center, under an arrangement that the Town Board is expected to approve next month.

The theater company has been performing at the center since September 1998; it had been operating under a three-year agreement, which called for $500 a month in rent this September. Last month Barry Liebman, who brought the theater to Yorktown, asked the board to drop the rent payment. He said that although the theater had drawn more than 100,000 people to its productions, it has not made a profit.

The board has informally agreed to drop the rent requirement, Supervisor Linda Cooper said, and has also granted a contract extension, which will expire in December 2004. Praising the theater's commitment, she said, ''I think it takes a while to establish an audience base.''
